comments: Reflected (A074058) tribonacci numbers A000073: A000073(n) = a(1-n).There is an alternative way to produce this sequence, from A000073, which is 0,0,1,1,2,4,7,13,24,44,... Call this {b(n)}. Taking x1 = (b(2))^2 - b(1)*b(3) = 0; x2 = (b(3))^2 - b(2)*b(4) = 1; x3 = (b(4))^2 - b(3)*b(5) = -1; x4 = 0, x5 = 2, we generate (0),0,1,-1,0,2,-3,1. - _John McNamara_, Jan 02 2004Pisano period lengths: 1, 4, 13, 8, 31, 52, 48, 16, 39, 124, 110, 104, 168, 48, 403, 32, 96, 156, 360, 248,... - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
references: Petho Attila, Posting to Number Theory List (NMBRTHRY(AT)LISTSERV.NODAK.EDU), Oct 06 2000.
M. Janjic, Determinants and Recurrence Sequences, Journal of Integer Sequences, 2012, Article 12.3.5. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 16 2012
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
M. Janjic, Recurrence Relations and Determinants, arXiv preprint arXiv:1112.2466, 2011
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-1,-1,1).
formula: G.f.: x^2/(1+x+x^2-x^3).G.f.: Q(0)*x^2/2 , where Q(k) = 1 + 1/(1 - x*(4*k+1 + x - x^2)/( x*(4*k+3 + x - x^2) - 1/Q(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 09 2013
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = polcoeff( if( n<0, x / ( 1 - x - x^2 - x^3), x^2 / ( 1 + x + x^2 - x^3) ) + x*O(x^abs(n)), abs(n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 03 2007 */(Haskell)a057597 n = a057597_list !! na057597_list = 0 : 0 : 1 : zipWith3 (\x y z -> - x - y + z)               (drop 2 a057597_list) (tail a057597_list) a057597_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 07 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 06 2000
